bug.author: ggeor84
bug.description:
Describe the bug For C#, when setting LogVerbosityLevel for SessionOptions, none of the various options seem to produce any output. In addition, it doesn't seem to be documented what each of the options produces. Urgency Medium System information
OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04): Windows 10 ONNX Runtime installed from (source or binary): source ONNX Runtime version: 1.2.0 Python version: N/A Visual Studio version (if applicable): VS 2017 GCC/Compiler version (if compiling from source): CUDA/cuDNN version: GPU model and memory:
To Reproduce You can reproduce the behavior by running e.g. C# PerfTool and adding one of the verbose options e.g.: options.LogVerbosityLevel = LogLevel.Verbose; Expected behavior Some output expected on the console window. In addition, better documentation for what each of the options is supposed to output Screenshots N/A Additional context N/A
